name: ARROW
notes:
The ARROW was once a popular one-design class on the Great Lakes. (though it is thought that less than 200 have been built.)
It survived a transition to fiberglass construction, but did not thrive as a result.
As best as can be determined, any kind of class organization had disappeared by 1970.
(Even a photograph has proved to be hard to find.)
Spinnakers were not permitted for class racing.
Pictured on a trailer is a later fiberglass version built by Stamm Boat Co.
